intro: Epidendrum deltastachyum, commonly known as the Florida flame orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to the southeastern United States. It features a sympodial growth habit with pseudobulbs that support its foliage and flowers. The plant produces vibrant orange-red flowers in late spring to early summer, arranged in racemes. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and often have a waxy coating. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and requires partial shade to full sun for optimal growth.
